Explanation: The doctor suggested a stool culture and microscopy, which is similar to stool culture and sensitivity, as both aim to identify the causative organism of diarrhea.
The doctor did not suggest 'Stool for ova and parasites' or a similar investigation to rule out parasitic infections as a cause of diarrhea.
The doctor did not suggest any investigation similar to 'Stool for reducing substances' or provide a justification related to checking for carbohydrate malabsorption.
The doctor suggested an 'Electrolyte panel' which is similar to 'Serum electrolytes' and serves the same purpose of assessing for electrolyte imbalances due to diarrhea.
The doctor suggested a Complete Blood Count (CBC) to assess for infection, which aligns with the justification of evaluating for signs of infection or inflammation.
The doctor did not suggest any investigations similar to 'Blood urea nitrogen (BUN) and creatinine' or provide a justification related to assessing kidney function and dehydration.
The doctor did not suggest any investigations similar to 'Urinalysis' with the justification of evaluating hydration status and ruling out urinary tract infection.
The doctor did not suggest any investigation similar to 'C-reactive protein (CRP)' or provide a justification related to assessing for inflammation or infection.
The doctor did not suggest any investigations specifically aimed at detecting rotavirus infection.
